question: Provision relating Personal Claims Of Government Servants as mentioned in the R&P 1983 do not apply to
answer: Defence, Railways and Post & Telegraph

question: Working day with respect to day on which payment is made means
answer: The day on which disbursing officer, AO/PAO and bank conducts ordinary business.

question: Where specific date for payment falls on holiday, the payment will be made on the
answer: Preceding working day

question: The monthly salary bills to be presented at the offices of the departmental PAO and CDDOs should reach the PAO/CDDA by
answer: 20th of the month to which the bill relates.

question: The monthly bills or pay and allowances of all Govt. servants posted at localities remote from the station of the concerned DDO may be presented to the AO/CDDO not earlier than
answer: 15th of the month to which the bill relates.

question: Bill is submitted not earlier than 15th of the month to which the bill relates so as to obtain the necessary outstation bank drafts to arrange for the despatch so as to reach the claimants within the
answer: First 7 working days of the next month

question: In the case of the Indian Missions abroad, pay and allowances may be disbursed in accordance with the local laws and custom pertaining to
answer: Locally recruited staff.

question: Cases in which drawl and disbursements for part of a month permitted are
answer: (i) on transfer, deputation, leave or vacation outside India to outside India and outside India to India; (ii) transferred to another account circle; or within the same account circle with DDO changes; (iii) on quitting service; (iv) on transfer to foreign service or deputation to State Government; (v) on leave from a post in a country outside India;

question: On occasions of local importance and following local practice, Heads of Indian Embassies, High Commissions or other Missions abroad, may authorise part payment of salary and allowances of the locally recruited employees for the period
answer: not beyond the date preceding the day of payment.

question: A separate pay bill should be prepared for
answer: (i) establishments whose charges are debitable to different heads of account ; (ii) personnel to whom salary is payable individually by cheques and; (iii) Group D employees

question: Non-gazetted employees whose names shall be omitted from Pay-bill are
answer: (i) Group D of central service (ii) All head constables/constables

question: Specified classes of establishments where entry of names in the pay bills is not essential for pre-check or audit purposes or both shall be determined by
answer: Government in consultation with the CAG

question: The form of a ledger for recording the dues payable and deductions made in respect of each claim for pay and allowances of a Government servant is
answer: Pay Bill Register (GAR 17)

question: Pay and allowance bills presented for payment in
answer: Abstract of Pay-bill (GAR 18)

question: Office copy of a regular monthly pay and allowances bill need
answer: Not be maintained.

question: Record that is maintained to prepare the section-wise acquittances rolls in large establishments where pay is disbursed through Section Supervisors is
answer: Pay-bill Check Register (GAR 19)

question: PWD Office submits demand statements for licence fee of public buildings recoverable from Government servants in
answer: Duplicate

question: Responsible for deduction on account of license fee is
answer: Head of Office/DDO

question: After the recovery is made, one copy of the demand statement shall be
answer: returned to the authority from which it was received

question: If the licence fee recoverable from a Govt. servant is limited to a certain percentage of his emoluments, the particulars of such emoluments shall be
answer: noted in the remarks column of the demand statement before its return.

question: Where the licence fee of a Govt. servant is limited to a certain percentage of his emoluments and his emolument is changed retrospectively, recovery of changed licence fee will be made from
answer: Retrospective effect.

question: The recovery of licence fee from the Central Government servants in respect of buildings belonging to a State may be made in accordance with such procedure as may be prescribed by
answer: The State Govt. & Central Govt. Department in consultation with AO

question: The detailed rules or procedure for recovery of licence fee in respect of such buildings under administrative control of a Central Govt. Departments other than PWD are prescribed by
answer: Department concerned in consultation with AO

question: Licence fee recovered is required to be remitted by the respective Accounts Officer to the Directorate of Estates by cheque or draft duly supported by the detailed schedules in cases where general pool accommodation is allotted to Officers
answer: Whose pay and allowances are drawn from other than Central Govt's Civil Estimates (Defence, Railways, P&T, State Govt)

question: A sum disallowed from a pay bill by the AO may be recovered from
answer: Next pay-bill.

question: A sum disallowed from a travelling allowance bill may be recovered from next pay bill of the Govt. servant if he/she does not present other travelling allowance bill within
answer: A month.

question: When the pay of a Govt. servant is attached by any order of a Court of Law, responsible to see that the proper deduction is made in satisfaction of such order is
answer: Officer receiving the attachment order

question: The extent to which the emoluments of a Government servant are exempt from attachment for debt is laid down in
answer: Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 [u/s 60(1)]

question: In execution of any decree other than a decree for maintenance, salary exempt to be attached to the extent of
answer: First â‚¹ 1000 and 2/3rd of remainder. Attachable- (salary-1000)/3

question: Where any part of the salary that has been under attachment, whether continuously or intermittently, for a total period of 24 months such portion shall be exempt from attachment until the expiry of further period of
answer: 12 months

question: Where attachment has been made in execution of one and the same decree, shall be finally exempt from attachment in execution of that decree after the attachment has continued for a total period of
answer: 24 months

question: In execution of any decree for maintenance, portion of salary exempted from attachment is
answer: 1/3rd Attachable- 2/3rd of salary

question: Salary with respect to attachment of pay by order of a Court means
answer: the total monthly emoluments excluding any allowance derived by a person from his employment whether on duty or on leave

question: Is Dearness Pay exempt from attachment by order of a Court
answer: Yes. It is exempt.

question: If an order of attachment against a Government servant is received before a previous order of attachment against the same Government servant has been fully complied with, the disbursing officer will
answer: honour the order if the total amount of decree is within the prescribed limit. Else will return the orders to courts with a statement showing the detail of existing attachment order.

question: In the event of attachment of pay, deductions on account of subscriptions to PF, Income Tax, dues of co-operative societies and debts due to Government should
answer: be made from non-attachable portion of the Government servant's salary

question: When the salary is payable in cash in the event of attachment, it should be paid on form_
answer: GAR 24

question: In the case of an attachment order issued by a Court in India against a Government servant whose pay and allowances are to be disbursed outside the local limits to which the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 extends, recovery will be
answer: Made by DDO of the Ministry/Department/UT concerned.

question: In cases in which a judgment-debtor does not sign the acquittance roll and intentionally allows his pay to remain undisbursed in order to evade payment on account of an attachment order issued by a Court of law,
answer: the head of the office may draw the pay of the judgment-debtor in satisfaction of the attachment order

question: The cost of remittance to a Court of money realised under its attachment order shall be borne by
answer: amount deducted from the amount realised and the net amount remitted to the Court

question: The profession tax is levied by
answer: The State Government.

question: The competent authority may authorises the drawl of pay and allowances of a newly appointed Government servant without a medical certificate of fitness for a period
answer: Not exceeding 2 months

question: The cost of remitting salary him by bank draft at par or Postal Money Order to a Government servant is out-stationed on tour shall be borne by
answer: Office contingency.

question: The pay and allowances due in respect of the old post which could not, be drawn at the time of a transfer should be paid on the basis of a Due & Drawn Statement raised by
answer: Present DDO and sent to previous DDO for verification

question: Is Pay and allowances or leave salary Government servant permissible to be paid away through agent
answer: Permissible. Subject to special authority of the Govt. and formal acquaintance through messenger or agent.

question: A register of power of attorney should be maintained by the disbursing officer in the form prescribed in the
answer: Government Securities Manual

question: Bond in GAR 47 may be executed by the bank include in the Schedule of RBI Act 1934
answer: 2nd Schedule.

question: State Cooperative banks, State-owned or control-led banks, which are not included in the Second Schedule to the RBI 1934 may be allowed to execute general bond by the
answer: Government in consultation with the RBI

question: The net leave salary due to a Group D shall, on his express request of, be remitted to him by the DDO by postal money order at Government expense if he proceeds on leave for a period
answer: Exceeding 1 month.

question: Where a Govt. servant proceeds on earned leave for a period exceeding 1 month, he may request to remittance, at Government cost, of leave salary by means of a
answer: Demand Draft

question: Is Overtime Allowance chargeable to Income Tax?
answer: Yes. Fully taxable.

question: Arrears of pay, fixed allowances or leave salary shall be drawn
answer: not in the ordinary monthly bill, but in a separate bill,

question: In cases where a period of leave is followed by transfer, any portion of leave salary which was not drawn at the old station, may be drawn at the
answer: New office

question: Government servants serving in the Missions abroad may, for the period of leave spent in India, draw their leave salary in India on bills drawn by
answer: the Department concerned on the basis of the LPC issued by the Mission concerned

question: The travelling allowance bills of Government servants proceeding on tour shall be presented at convenient intervals during the period of their tour or immediately on return to the headquarters and, as far as practicable, before
answer: 31st March, if the tour has been completed before that date

question: The detail of legal acquittance for having received payment obtained in an Acquittance Roll in Form G.A.R. 24 will be filled in from
answer: Bill Check Register (GAR 19)

question: Pay and allowances can be drawn for the day of the Government servant's death, day for this purpose means
answer: a calendar day beginning and ending at midnight.

question: Where payment drawn through a cannot be made within the course of the month, the amount drawn for the payee shall
answer: be refunded by short drawing in the next bill,

question: The amount of undisbursed pay and allowances may be retained by Head of Office for any period
answer: not exceeding 3 months

question: An abstract of amounts remaining undisbursed for three months should be prepared on the basis of entries made in
answer: Register of Undisbursed Pay and Allowances, etc. (gar 25)

question: the last payment of pay or allowances in respect of a Govt. servant who finally quits service or who is placed under suspension may be made only after satisfaction of
answer: Head of office

question: Part of Retirement benefits which may be with-hold to cover the demand of Govt. at the time quitting the service
answer: Gratuity.

question: Pay and allowances of all kinds claimed on behalf of a deceased Government servant may be paid without production of usual legal authority by the Head of Office provided value of such claim
answer: does not exceed â‚¹ 10000/- . However, Indemnity Bond (GAR 26) and minimum one surety is required.

question: Where the claim exceeds â‚¹ 10000/-, payment will be made by the Head of Office only on the execution of an indemnity bond in Form GAR 26 duly stamped and
answer: such sureties (normally two) as may be deemed necessary.
